meanings.definition: To shut with force and noise
meanings.sent1: She was slamming the door to show her frustration.
meanings.sent2: He kept slamming the window shut to keep out the cold.
meanings.sent3: The wind was slamming the door so loudly, it sounded like a drumbeat.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain was slamming against the windows all night long.
meanings.sent5: The old gate kept slamming shut every time the wind blew.

meanings.sent1: The teacher was slamming the student for not completing the assignment.
meanings.sent2: The movie critic kept slamming the new film for its poor acting.
meanings.sent3: She was slamming her friend's outfit, but it was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: The journalist was slamming the government's decision in his latest article.
meanings.sent5: The coach was slamming the team's performance during the game.

meanings.sent1: The group was slamming on the dance floor all night long.
meanings.sent2: She loves to slam to the beat of the music at parties.
meanings.sent3: The kids were slamming around the living room, having a dance-off.
meanings.sent4: The dancers were slamming in perfect sync with the music.
meanings.sent5: The crowd started slamming as soon as the DJ played their favorite song.

meanings.sent1: He was slamming the ball against the wall during practice.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was slamming the hammer to drive in the nail.
meanings.sent3: The boxer was slamming his opponent with powerful punches.
meanings.sent4: The thunder was slamming so loudly, it shook the entire house.
meanings.sent5: The waves were slamming against the rocks with great force.
